page.title: 18FISHING ON THE BLACKWATER
page.content: I am a member of Kelvedon and District Angling Association. Behind where I live is the River Blackwater. It comes from Coggeshall to Kelvedon, it goes through Easterford Mill and then goes to Bridgefoot Mill. K.D.A.A. owns a large number of lakes and rivers, such as Silver End Lake,which is one of my favourite fishing spots. My biggest fish to date is a chub which weighed 2lb. 15oz. The river Blackwater has many different species of fish in it; such as roach, chub dace, minnows, ruff, eels, gudgeon and perch. I have fished one match on the Blackwater this season, in which I came second. My brother came first in the same match.
